text: (contemplative music begins)
(contemplative music continues)
(contemplative music continues)
(peaceful guitar music begins)
(peaceful guitar music begins)

- I've always been intrigued
by the Western lifestyle.
I grew up around it.
I rode saddle bronc horses
for about 15 years, professionally.

I was a rodeo coach at Blue
Mountain Community College
for 10 years.
A little fresh.

- [Sammy] Yeah, he's
feeling good that one.
- The horse is feeling good.
My family's always participated in it,
and now my kids have participated in it.
- So this is our barn.
We have 20 head of horses, rodeo horses,
brood mares, babies.
Horses that we raise.

We usually raise, oh, anywhere
from two to three a year.
We're kind of small.
We spend most time rodeo-in'.

My oldest son is 15 and
he high school rodeos.
My youngest is seven and he peewee rodeos.
Yeah, go on buddy.
And Shawn and I both pro rodeo,

so it's the moment we
get up, get the kids up,
get horses fed, they're taken care of.
Stalls cleaned.

I do homeschool, so
it's a hectic schedule.
(energetic orchestral music begins)

- [Shawn] Farm City Fence is
a residential, commercial,
industrial, fence company.

- [Ted] There's a building
that sits here somewhere.
- [Shawn] This ain't a fence here.
- No, that's my overdraw.
I met Shawn in fourth grade.
We just hit it off.
His dad and mom basically took me in.
- [Shawn] We spent a lot of time together

as kids, fishing, hunting,
playing basketball.
It was a good fit.

- I come from kind of
a single parent home.

One day Shawn and his
dad were going hunting.
I was kind of bummed about it,

and I didn't really have that
opportunity at that point
not having a dad around,

Tic, his dad, come in and sat
down on the bed next to me,
and put his arm around me and said,
"Hey, it'll be okay, I'm here,
you're part of my family now."
From then on we went,
I got to go hunting with him,
and it was it was a life changer.
- This is the first trailer.

We eventually got this truck,
which was our first truck.
We were big time, we thought. (laughs)
- Yeah, we were thinking we were big time.
(contemplative guitar music)

A huge part of our success
is our communication,

not only between Shawn and
I on projects, but Sammy.

We round table it and kind
of come up with a plan,
and it's been our success.
To get us to this level,

to work for the customers
that we work for.
(grinder whirring)

- [Sammy] With Farm City
Fence, I am the CFO,

so I help oversee all the
contracts before they go out.

The market for the type of
fence is always changing,
upgrades and different materials.
So it's a learning curve always.

- [Ted] We started working
with AWS about 10 years ago,

to install high security
fences around their sites.

- [Shawn] I think their
partnership with us has taught us

to really step back and research
what we're getting into,
and also think forward as far as you can.
Fence here is a K rated crash fence,
so vehicles cannot penetrate past it.

- [Ted] When AWS asked
us to develop this fence,
it was a big task at the time.
- We sat down and did our homework on it.
I call it the skittle cowboy try.
At the end of the day,
we determined that it was just a fence,

so if it was level and
straight, we could build it.
(contemplative music)
I think we've grown with AWS,

they demand a lot but they
also put back in a lot,

to not only the local
contractors that works for 'em,
but the community as well.
- [Ted] Several businesses, not just ours,

have benefited from the growth
that they've brought here.
My son Devin

runs the residential light
commercial side of the business.

- I wanted to follow in
my father's footsteps,
so I came on full-time here,

started digging holes
and packing concrete.

Slowly worked my way up
to a management position,

where I was a foreman
over our crew for a while,
but now I'm in the office.
Best thing about working here
is definitely the family environment.
- [Ted] Shawn and I are like brothers.

I love getting out of
bed and coming to shop.
For him and I to be able to
create an opportunity like this,
and then have our kids and close friends,
come up and work with us,
has been a very rewarding part of my life.
Those people are gonna continue

to keep this business
thriving and going forward,
our dream.

- [Shawn] I feel fortunate
to obviously have my company,
but also I've worked hard for it.

That's kind of a give and take
of just me, I guess (laughs).
(contemplative music fades)
